newsitem.title: GUYANA: Guyana leader's health worsens in U.S. hospital.
newsitem.headline: Guyana leader's health worsens in U.S. hospital.

text.p: Guyana's President Cheddi Jagan's condition sharply deteriorated on Monday at the U.S. hospital where he underwent heart surgery two weeks ago, government officials said.

"The president's heart's condition deteriorated this morning and his lungs are not working properly," Information Minister Moses Nagamootoo told Reuters. He called Jagan's condition "extremely critical."

Doctors at Walter Reed Army Medical Centre near Washington performed on the 78-year-old leader a procedure called angioplasty to clear blocked arteries after he was flown from Georgetown on Feb. 15 suffering from heart pains.
